original: gangs kyi ri'i rgyal po la sman sna bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gangs kyi ri'i rgyal po la sman sna bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of medicines on the king of snow mountains.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gcig tu ni kha dog dang ro thams cad kyi gnas dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / gnyis su na nad thams cad las rab tu thar par byed pa zhes bya ba dang / gsum du na dug thams cad las thar bar byed pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: gcig tu ni kha dog dang ro thams cad kyi gnas dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / gnyis su na nad thams cad las rab tu thar par byed pa zhes bya ba dang / gsum du na dug thams cad las thar bar byed pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: First, it is called the abode of all colors and tastes. Second, it is called the liberator from all illnesses. Third, it is called the liberator from all poisons.

original: bzhir na gnas gang na 'dug par bde ba sbyin pa zhes bya ba dang de bzhi yod do snyam mo //
analyzed: bzhir na gnas gang na 'dug par bde ba sbyin pa zhes bya ba dang de bzhi yod do snyam mo //
translated: Fourth, it is called the giver of happiness wherever one stays. I think that these four exist.”

original: de nas dmus long de la sman pa des snying rje bskyed nas /
analyzed: de nas dmus long de la sman pa des snying rje bskyed nas /
translated: Then the doctor, out of compassion for the blind man,

original: thabs gang gis gangs kyi ri'i rgyal po la 'gro nus pa de lta bu'i thabs bsams te /🔽song nas yar @80b yang 'dzegs /
analyzed: thabs gang gis gangs kyi ri'i rgyal po la 'gro nus pa de lta bu'i thabs bsams te / song nas yar @80b yang 'dzegs /
translated: thought of a way to get him to the king of snow mountains.🔽He went there and climbed up.

original: mar yang babs //
analyzed: mar yang babs //
translated: He went down.

original: ngos la'ang btsal to //
analyzed: ngos la'ang btsal to //
translated: He searched the slopes.

original: de ltar btsal te /
analyzed: de ltar btsal te /
translated: He searched in this way.

original: sman de sna bzhi rnyed nas /🔽rnyed pa dang kha cig ni sos bcas te byin /
analyzed: sman de sna bzhi rnyed nas / rnyed pa dang kha cig ni sos bcas te byin /
translated: He found the four kinds of medicine.🔽When he found them, he chewed some and gave it to him.

original: kha cig ni btags /
analyzed: kha cig ni btags /
translated: He gave some to him to drink.

original: kha cig ni phrad gzhan dang sbyar la btsos te sbyin /
analyzed: kha cig ni phrad gzhan dang sbyar la btsos te sbyin /
translated: Some he cooked with other ingredients and gave to them.

original: kha cig ni phrad rlon pa dang sbyar te byin /
analyzed: kha cig ni phrad rlon pa dang sbyar te byin /
translated: Some he gave to them raw with other ingredients.

original: kha cig ni lus kyi gnas thur mas phug ste blugs /
analyzed: kha cig ni lus kyi gnas thur mas phug ste blugs /
translated: Some he gave to them after piercing their body parts with a spoon.

original: kha cig ni mes bsregs te byin /
analyzed: kha cig ni mes bsregs te byin /
translated: Some he gave to them after burning them with fire.

original: kha cig ni phrad gzhan dang sbyar te /
analyzed: kha cig ni phrad gzhan dang sbyar te /
translated: Some he gave to them after mixing them with other ingredients.

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa dang bsres te byin no //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa dang bsres te byin no //
translated: He gave them food and drink mixed with other ingredients.

original: de nas dmus long de thabs sbyar ba des mig thob bo //
analyzed: de nas dmus long de thabs sbyar ba des mig thob bo //
translated: Then, by this method, the blind man obtained his sight.

original: des mig thob nas /
analyzed: des mig thob nas /
translated: After he obtained his sight,

original: phyi dang / nang dang / ring po dang / nye ba dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od dang / skar ma dang / gza'i gzugs thams cad kyang mthong nas /
analyzed: phyi dang / nang dang / ring po dang / nye ba dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i 'od dang / skar ma dang / gza'i gzugs thams cad kyang mthong nas /
translated: he saw the outside, the inside, the far, the near, the light of the moon and sun, and all the forms of the stars and planets.

original: 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'di skad ces /
translated: He said this:

original: kye ma / aa la la blun po kho bo sngon ni bstan kyang yid mi ches shing smras pa bzhin mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: kye ma / aa la la blun po kho bo sngon ni bstan kyang yid mi ches shing smras pa bzhin mi 'dzin na /
translated: “Oh! Oh! I, the fool, before did not believe what was shown to me and did not hold to what was said.

original: da ni kho bos thams cad mthong nas dmus long las thar te kho bos mig thob pas /
analyzed: da ni kho bos thams cad mthong nas dmus long las thar te kho bos mig thob pas /
translated: Now I have seen everything. I am freed from being blind and have obtained my sight.

original: kho bo lta bur khyad par du 'phags pa gang yang med do zhes smras so //
analyzed: kho bo lta bur khyad par du 'phags pa gang yang med do zhes smras so //
translated: There is no one superior to me.’

original: de'i tshe na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon sum du bya ba la mkhas pa dag cig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul mngon sum du bya ba la mkhas pa dag cig yod de /
translated: “At that time there were some sages who possessed the five kinds of supernatural perception, the divine eye, the divine ear, the knowledge of the thoughts of others, the knowledge of past lives, and the knowledge of magical powers.

original: de dag gis mi de la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: de dag gis mi de la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: They said to that man,

original: kye / mi khyod ni mig rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /🔽khyod gzhan @81a *//
analyzed: kye / mi khyod ni mig rnyed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi / khyod gzhan @81a *//
translated: ‘Hey, you! You have only obtained eyes.🔽You do not know anything else.

original: ci'ang mi shes na khyod kyi nga rgyal de ci las byung /🔽khyod la ni shes rab kyang med /
analyzed: ci'ang mi shes na khyod kyi nga rgyal de ci las byung / khyod la ni shes rab kyang med /
translated: Where does your pride come from?🔽You have no wisdom.

original: mkhas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: You are not learned.’

original: de dag gis yang de la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: de dag gis yang de la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: They said to him,

original: kye; mi khyod gang gi tshe khyim gyi nang na 'dug pa na /
analyzed: kye; mi khyod gang gi tshe khyim gyi nang na 'dug pa na /
translated: ‘Hey, you! When you are in your house,

original: phyi logs kyi gzugs gzhan dag mi mthong mi shes /
analyzed: phyi logs kyi gzugs gzhan dag mi mthong mi shes /
translated: you do not see or know any other forms outside.

original: khyod kyis sems can gang dag byams par sems pa dang / gnod par sems pa de dag kyang mi shes /
analyzed: khyod kyis sems can gang dag byams par sems pa dang / gnod par sems pa de dag kyang mi shes /
translated: You do not know whether you are loving or harming sentient beings.

original: dpag tshad lnga'i bar na 'dug pa'i smra ba dang / rnga dang / dung la sogs pa'i sgra'ang mi shes mi thos /
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga'i bar na 'dug pa'i smra ba dang / rnga dang / dung la sogs pa'i sgra'ang mi shes mi thos /
translated: You do not know or hear the sounds of drums, conches, and so forth, even when they are played five yojanas away.

original: rgyang grags gcig gi bar du gom pa mi 'dor bar 'gro'ang mi nus /
analyzed: rgyang grags gcig gi bar du gom pa mi 'dor bar 'gro'ang mi nus /
translated: You cannot walk without taking a step every two fathoms.

original: ma'i lto na skye zhing 'phel ba'i byed pa de dag kyang mi dran na /
analyzed: ma'i lto na skye zhing 'phel ba'i byed pa de dag kyang mi dran na /
translated: You do not remember the activities of growing and developing in your mother’s womb.

original: ji ltar mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhas pa yin /
translated: How can you be wise?

original: ji ltar na thams cad mthong zhes smra /
analyzed: ji ltar na thams cad mthong zhes smra /
translated: How can you say that you see everything?

original: kye; mi khyod kyis snang ba gang yin pa de ni mun par shes so //🔽mun pa gang yin pa de ni snang bar shes so zhes smras pa dang / de nas mi des drang srong de dag la 'di skad ces smras te /
analyzed: kye; mi khyod kyis snang ba gang yin pa de ni mun par shes so // mun pa gang yin pa de ni snang bar shes so zhes smras pa dang / de nas mi des drang srong de dag la 'di skad ces smras te /
translated: ‘O man, you say that what is light is known as darkness,🔽and that what is darkness is known as light.’

original: thabs gang dang dge ba'i las ci byas na /
analyzed: thabs gang dang dge ba'i las ci byas na /
translated: Then the man said to the sages, ‘What methods and what virtuous actions

original: 'di 'dra ba'i shes rab 'thob /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i shes rab 'thob /
translated: must be done in order to attain such wisdom?’

original: khyod kyi bya dga' la yon tan de dag thob par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyi bya dga' la yon tan de dag thob par gyis shig /
translated: You should obtain those qualities as your reward.”

original: de nas drang srong de dag gis mi de la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas drang srong de dag gis mi de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the sages said to the man,

original: gal te 'dod na 'brog dgon par gnas par gyis /
analyzed: gal te 'dod na 'brog dgon par gnas par gyis /
translated: “If you wish, you may live in the wilderness.

original: yang na brag phug tu 'dug la chos sems shing khyod kyis nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na brag phug tu 'dug la chos sems shing khyod kyis nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ste /
translated: Or, if you live in a cave, contemplate the Dharma and abandon your afflictions.

original: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon @81b tan dang ldan na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyangs pa'i yon @81b tan dang ldan na /
translated: If you possess the qualities of austerity in that way,

original: mngon par shes pa rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: you will attain the superknowledges.”

original: de nas mi des de'i don blangs te /
analyzed: de nas mi des de'i don blangs te /
translated: Then the man took their advice to heart,

original: rab tu byung nas dgon pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas dgon pa la gnas te /
translated: went forth, and lived in the wilderness.

original: sems rtse gcig pas 'jig rten gyi sred pa spangs te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pas 'jig rten gyi sred pa spangs te /
translated: With one-pointed mind, he abandoned worldly craving,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga thob bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga thob bo //
translated: and attained the five superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga thob nas bsams pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga thob nas bsams pa /
translated: After attaining the five superknowledges, he thought,

original: sngon bdag gis las gzhan byas pa des bdag gis yon tan gang yang ma thob bo //
analyzed: sngon bdag gis las gzhan byas pa des bdag gis yon tan gang yang ma thob bo //
translated: “Because of the other actions I have done in the past, I have not attained any good qualities at all.

original: da ni gar bsams par 'gro'o //
analyzed: da ni gar bsams par 'gro'o //
translated: Now I will go wherever I wish.”

original: sngon bdag ni shes rab chung zhing rtogs pa chung ste /
analyzed: sngon bdag ni shes rab chung zhing rtogs pa chung ste /
translated: I was previously of little wisdom and little understanding.

original: bdag gi ni dmus long du gyur pa'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gi ni dmus long du gyur pa'o snyam mo //
translated: I was like one born blind.”

original: 'od srung / de ltar don de rig par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar don de rig par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Kāśyapa, in order to understand this meaning,

original: dpe 'di byas te de'i don ni 'di ltar blta'o //
analyzed: dpe 'di byas te de'i don ni 'di ltar blta'o //
translated: this analogy is given. The meaning of this should be seen in the following way.

original: 'od srung / dmus long zhes bya ba de ni sems can 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams kyi tshig bla dvags te /
analyzed: 'od srung / dmus long zhes bya ba de ni sems can 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams kyi tshig bla dvags te /
translated: “Kāśyapa, ‘one born blind’ is a term for sentient beings who remain in the five destinies of saṃsāra.

original: gang dag dam pa'i chos mi shes shing; nyon mongs pa'i mun pa mun nag skyed pa de dag ma rig pas ldongs so //
analyzed: gang dag dam pa'i chos mi shes shing; nyon mongs pa'i mun pa mun nag skyed pa de dag ma rig pas ldongs so //
translated: Those who do not know the true Dharma, who give rise to the darkness of the afflictions, are blinded by ignorance.

original: ma rig pas ldongs pas 'du byed sogs so //
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs pas 'du byed sogs so //
translated: Blinded by ignorance, they create formations.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs nas /
translated: With formations as a condition, there is name and form.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa de'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa de'i bar du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, up to the arising of the great mass of pure suffering.

original: de ltar ma rig pas ldongs te /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pas ldongs te /
translated: Thus, blinded by ignorance,

original: sems can 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje bskyed nas /
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba na gnas pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje bskyed nas /
translated: The Tathagata, having generated compassion for sentient beings who abide in cyclic existence,🔽although he has transcended the three realms,

original: khams gsum las 'das kyang bu gcig pa'i pha byams pa bzhin du /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'das kyang bu gcig pa'i pha byams pa bzhin du /
translated: like a father's love for his only son,

original: thugs rje chen po bskyed nas khams gsum du gshegs te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po bskyed nas khams gsum du gshegs te /
translated: having generated great compassion, he goes to the three realms.

original: sems @82a *// can rnams 'khor ba'i 'khor lo na 'khyam zhing nyon mongs kyang de dag 'khor ba las 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes par de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
analyzed: sems @82a *// can rnams 'khor ba'i 'khor lo na 'khyam zhing nyon mongs kyang de dag 'khor ba las 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes par de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab kyi spyan gyis gzigs so //
translated: Although sentient beings wander in the cycle of existence and are afflicted, they do not know the correct way to emerge from cyclic existence. The Bhagavan sees them with the eye of wisdom.

original: gzigs nas kyang sems can 'di dag sngon dge ba byas pas zhe sdang chung la 'dod chags che ba dang / 'dod chags chung la zhe sdang che ba dang / kha cig shes rab chung ba dang / kha cig mkhas pa dang / kha cig yongs su smin cing dag pa dang /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang sems can 'di dag sngon dge ba byas pas zhe sdang chung la 'dod chags che ba dang / 'dod chags chung la zhe sdang che ba dang / kha cig shes rab chung ba dang / kha cig mkhas pa dang / kha cig yongs su smin cing dag pa dang /
translated: Having seen them, he knows that some of these sentient beings, due to previously performing virtue, have little hatred and much attachment, some have little attachment and much hatred, some have little wisdom, some are learned, some are fully ripened and pure,

original: kha cig log par lta ba mkhyen nas /
analyzed: kha cig log par lta ba mkhyen nas /
translated: and some have wrong views.

original: sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas theg pa gsum du bshad do //
analyzed: sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa thabs mkhas pas theg pa gsum du bshad do //
translated: The Tathāgata, with his skillful means, teaches them the three vehicles.🔽“Just as those sages, endowed with the five superknowledges and with pure eyes,

original: de la ji ltar drang srong de dag mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan zhing mig rnam par dag pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: de la ji ltar drang srong de dag mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan zhing mig rnam par dag pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: having generated the intention to achieve enlightenment,

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas /
translated: attain the acceptance of the fact that there are no events that originate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar blta'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar blta'o //
translated: and then attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: de la sman pa chen po de ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs par blta'o //
analyzed: de la sman pa chen po de ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs par blta'o //
translated: “just so, the Tathāgata is like the great physician.

original: dmus long ji lta ba bzhin du gti mug gis ldongs pa'i sems can du blta'o //
analyzed: dmus long ji lta ba bzhin du gti mug gis ldongs pa'i sems can du blta'o //
translated: Beings, blinded by ignorance, are like the man born blind.

original: rlung dang; mkhris pa dang / bad gan ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su gyur par blta'o //
analyzed: rlung dang; mkhris pa dang / bad gan ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su gyur par blta'o //
translated: Desire, hatred, ignorance, and the sixty-two views are like wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: ji ltar sman sna bzhi po @82b de ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgor blta'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sman sna bzhi po @82b de ltar stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgor blta'o //
translated: The four medicines should be seen as the doors to emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and nirvāṇa.

original: ji lta ji lta bur sman rnams btang bas /
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bur sman rnams btang bas /
translated: Just as the medicines are administered,

original: de lta de lta bur nad rab tu zhi ba de bzhin du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgoms pas ma rig pa 'gag par byed cing /
analyzed: de lta de lta bur nad rab tu zhi ba de bzhin du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa bsgoms pas ma rig pa 'gag par byed cing /
translated: in the same way, by cultivating the doors to liberation—emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness—ignorance is stopped.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa nas /
translated: When ignorance ceases, formations cease,

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa de'i bar du 'gag par gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa de'i bar du 'gag par gyur te /
translated: and in the same way, the whole great mass of suffering ceases.

original: de bzhin du de'i sems dge ba la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i sems dge ba la'ang mi gnas /
translated: In the same way, their minds do not rest in virtue

original: sdig pa la'ang mi gnas te /
analyzed: sdig pa la'ang mi gnas te /
translated: or in nonvirtue.

original: ji ltar dmus long gis mig mthong ba de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can du blta'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dmus long gis mig mthong ba de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can du blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as like the blind seeing forms, and as like those in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa gcod cing nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba las rnam par grol te khams gsum gyi 'gro ba drug las rab tu thar bas na /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa gcod cing nyon mongs pa'i bcing ba las rnam par grol te khams gsum gyi 'gro ba drug las rab tu thar bas na /
translated: They cut through the bonds of the afflictions of saṃsāra and are completely liberated from the bonds of the afflictions. They are completely liberated from the six classes of beings in the three realms.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi 'di ltar shes nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa can gyi 'di ltar shes nas /
translated: Therefore, those who follow the Śrāvakayāna think like this:

original: 'di skad ces mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos gzhan med de /
analyzed: 'di skad ces mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos gzhan med de /
translated: ‘There is no other Dharma to be fully awakened to.

original: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob bo zhes zer ro //
translated: I have attained nirvāṇa.’

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de la chos ston te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa de la chos ston te /
translated: Then the Tathāgata teaches them the Dharma:

original: gang gis chos thams cad ma thob pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa ga la yod ces de bzhin gshegs pas de dag byang chub tu btsud de /
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad ma thob pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa ga la yod ces de bzhin gshegs pas de dag byang chub tu btsud de /
translated: ‘Where is there nirvāṇa for those who have not attained all dharmas?’ The Tathāgata introduces them to awakening.

original: de byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas 'khor ba la'ang @83a *//
analyzed: de byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas 'khor ba la'ang @83a *//
translated: They give rise to the mind of awakening and neither remain in saṃsāra

original: mi gnas / mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gnas / mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par yang mi 'gyur ro //
